Name: Clash of Galliformes: Untamed Pheasants
Description:
This expansion allows you to play solo in Clash of Galliformes. Expand and explore to be able to fight back The Untamed Pheasants.

—description from the designer

Name: Putin's Pocket: Ukrainian Cauldron at Debaltseve – Feb 2015
Description:
Putin's Pocket is a game on the face-off between Ukrainian and Russian forces at the Debaltseve pocket, which protruded like a finger into the Russian\DPR front lines in January, 2015.

The pro-Russian forces were unable to collapse the Ukrainian pocket or cut it off in January even as Putin allowed Russian battalion tactical groups to gradually take over. The whole area became a target for the many Russian artillery within range and was heavily bombarded.

Name: Donetsk!: Ukrainian Inferno at Ilovaisk – August 2014
Description: Ukrainian Inferno is a game on the near success of the Ukrainian forces during August, 2014. In July, these forces had cut up and isolated many of the pro-Russian forces called the DPA who were fully supported by Russia. The Ukrainian forces were in a near win position after months of fighting, having cut the main arteries for supply used by the DPA. While it looked promising, there remained one main highway used by the DPA that supplied those forces in and around Donetsk, a large urban-like area they controlled.

Name: Disputed Land: War in Azerbaijan – 2020
Description:
Disputed Land covers the flashpoint war between Armenia and Azerbaijan over the Armenian controlled territory of Nagorno-Karabakh, which was won in 1994.

This territory was Azerbaijan's prior to 1994. The loss was never agreed to and remained a bone of contention between the two countries. As time went on, Azerbaijan became sovereign country and quickly built up its former Soviet army. Russia remains allied to both countries now but has a defense pact with Armenia. It also sells both countries its military weapons.

While Azerbaijan built up its military forces that are superior to Arme-nia, Armenia did could not match them due to the fact Azerbaijan used revenue from oil. By 2020, it was time for Azerbaijan to reclaim the disputed loss area.

In late September of 2020, Azer forces made a surprise attack across the Nagorno front positions and slowly made in roads. The opposing forces were fewer but it was the terrain that would determine success. But the war did bring into view future warfare using deadly armed drones that Azer forces bought from Turkey and Israel. Unable to shoot them down, Armenian tanks and radar were decimated within a week losing 173 T-72 tanks, 257 APC, 67 rocket launched artillery, 23 SAM, and 14 radar. It was a staggering blow and great military feat of future warfare tactics.

Eventually, Armenia agreed to a ceasefire in mid-October. Azer forces took the time to redirect their offensive and unleash its 1st Corps along the Iranian border on the 18th. This was a brilliant move catching the Armenian forces off guard in the Fuzuli\Fizuli area. the Azer armor and mechanized formations raced deep into Nagorno territory coming with-in 20 km of the key town of Lachin in the mountains. If taken, Azer would cutoff the only supply road into Nagorno. As Azer forces cau-tiously approached, Armenian military units in Goris began to counter-attack halting further advance. Being that the two lane road was sur-rounded my 4000 ft. mountains, Azer forces pulled back on Oct. 24.

Now, Azer forces switched to another attack from Fizuli towards Shusha and the Nagorno capital. This main attack was a slugfest due to the mountainous terrain. Armenian troops fought tooth and nail but by Nov.4, Azer forces were within 10 km of Stepanakert and nearly sur-rounded Shusha. If either fell, again, the main supply road would be cut. Bitter fighting and artillery fire continued until Nov. 9, when Shusha fell to Azer.

It was now Armenia agreed to Russia's peace plan. Estimated losses were up to 8000 men, well over 300 tanks lost total and hundreds of artillery guns or rocket launchers.
LESS

Name: Detox
Description:
DETOX a drinking card game.

The essence of the game: Each card has a task to complete. If you don't comply, you must drink. There are many, many exciting tasks ahead of you. You might even grow a mustache during the game, or you might lose a cold shower, but you might even finally be able to lick your elbows. Get ready because this game will be an experience of a lifetime. The more tasks you do, you get more chance to winning the game, and not hanging drunk.

Why choose the DETOX drinking game:

It is provided with a drip-resistant foil so it does not get soaked.

It is 2x the size of a French card, so you will see it perfectly even when drunk.

Made of the highest quality material.

Name: Hostage Negotiator: Expansiones #9 y #10
Description: This item combines two previously separate expansions to Hostage Negotiator (Abductor Pack 9 and Abductor Pack 10).

Name: 24 Days Escape: 3D-Adventskalender – Sherlock Holmes und die letzte Fahrt der Titanic
Description:
1912, somewhere in the North Atlantic: Dark machinations are going on aboard the Titanic - and the luxury liner is heading straight for disaster. To bring light into the darkness here, a genius alone is not enough: Master detective Sherlock Holmes meets the "thinking machine" Professor van Dusen!

On the hunt for your next story, follow master detective Sherlock Holmes and his faithful companion Dr. John Watson on the maiden voyage of the RMS Titanic. And aboard the luxury liner, crime is not long in coming. Who is the culprit? Is it the eccentric Professor van Dusen, the mysterious Miss DeStrese or even the captain himself? You have 24 hours to solve the case ...

Open 24 doors with exciting tasks and puzzle your way through the most magnificent cruise ship of all time. Discover the secrets of the proud 3D Titanic and combine them with the many finds from the Advent calendar. Only with the right solution will you find out where the adventure continues. If you manage to solve all the puzzles, close the case and save the ship, then it's free sailing for a happy holiday!
Families: History: The Sinking of the Titanic
Misc: Advent / Christmas / Jule calendar game

Name: Hostage Negotiator: Pack Peticiones #1 y #2
Description:
This item combines two previously separate expansions to Hostage Negotiator (Demand Pack #1 and Demand Pack #2).

Demand Pack #1 is an expansion pack that comes with 16 new cards that will add new major demands for the original abductors (Arkayne, Donna, and Edward) as well as the abductors from Abductor Packs 1-2 and 3-4. These cards will breathe new life into abductors you've faced off against before.

Demand Pack #1 was a stretch goal that was achieved in the Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave Kickstarter campaign.

Demand Pack #2 is an entire pack of 16 all-new cards to use with the abductors featured in Crime Wave (Barrett, Lijah, and Renesha), as well as abductors in Abductor Packs (5-6 and 7-8! Just like Demand Pack #1, this will bring a whole new challenge to abductors you've faced in the past!

Name: Puzzle-Rätsel-Adventskalender:  Das Dunkle Geheimnis der Geschenkefabrik
Description:
The puzzle Advent calendar is about GenialGeschenk GmbH. This company has only one goal: to make its customers happy. Since the worst case scenario occurs on the first of December and the production machine displays several defects, you set out as an emergency repair team to get the machine up and running again in time. You quickly get the feeling that something is wrong. You get on the track of a dark secret...

Will you be able to save not only Christmas, but also the carefree future of the recipients? In addition to the 24 detailed puzzles and the magnifying glass, there is also an instruction booklet with a mysterious story and exciting puzzles.
Families: Misc: Advent / Christmas / Jule calendar game

Name: Complete Murder Mystery Night
Description:
A perfect way to entertain your friends and family, now you can host your very own Murder Mystery Night. The Complete Murder Mystery Night game is presented in a whiskey gift box, elegantly finished with matt black wrapping and gold foil. Containing everything you need for 10 different fun and entertaining Murder Mystery Nights. With different games included, you can host on 10 different occasions. From invitations to a newspaper that lays out the plots of ten gruesome murders, all the players need to do is work out whodunnit! The stylized newspaper containing plots and recipes for your perfect night in. Instructions, character booklets, instructions, name stickers and the murder cards are also included in this wonderfully designed whiskey tube-style packaging. Presented in an elegant whiskey-style gift tube, this murder mystery game makes a perfect dinner party gift. This game is suitable for ages 14 + years.

Contents
    Newspaper containing plots and recipes
    10 x character booklets
    10 x murder cards
    2 x sheets of name stickers

Name: USC: Reach
Description:
USC Reach is a competitive turn-based space journey game for 2 to 4 players, where you discover the marvels of the universe, rescue rookie space travelers, scavenge resources, and improve your Crew and ship, by using deck building, hand management, and variable phase order mechanics.

Your goal is to secure a safe landing on the new planet and collect the most points to win the game. To do that, gather your crew and allocate them strategically to your ship departments to overcome the challenges of space before others while keeping an eye on your landing requirements.

—description from the designer

Name: Christmas Scavenger Hunt
Description: Christmas Scavenger Hunt features hundreds of cards with typical objects that can be found around the house at Christmas.  Deal out some cards to each team and get hunting. It's that simple!

Name: Posdata
Description:
Have you ever written a letter and mailed it?
Did you have friends or pen pals?

That is why we ventured into this game that invites and challenges us to write letters. Some unexpected. Others, perhaps, waiting for the right time to see the light. Postdata reconnects us with the universe of the manuscript, where we can capture ideas, feelings, wishes, desires... where hope and expectation are the protagonists.


The deck has 50 cards: 15 possible recipients, 10 letter types, 10 epistolary fragments and 15 postscripts.

Players choose (or randomly select) one of each, and write a letter according to them. Who you are writing to, which type of letter, a fragment to inspire you, and a postscript option to use to finish the letter.

Then choose the best letter and send it!

Name: ¿Qué Hace un Hombre con una Sardina en la Cabeza?
Description:
It all started in a chance encounter with old Captain Sargasso. He was going down the street alone, lurching to port and starboard and bumping into everything that got in his way. When he crossed paths with me, he took my arm tightly and showed me a worn and half-torn map, with drawings and nonsensical phrases that filled each sheet.

Then, out of the blue, he burst out laughing, left me the map and said goodbye shouting into the wind: "And that's how I ended up with a sardine on my head!" Since then I have had time to look at that old nautical chart many times, and I have always been curious to know what they meant, and what meaning those phrases and drawings had and, of course, what relationship they had with a sardine on the head of a man.

Maybe you are able to make sense of this story... Or not.

In addition to this witty story, the game brings a series of images and texts that will make sense when you put your imagination to work. There is only one question: What is a man doing with a sardine on his head? but countless possible answers. From the cards and their combination, you will be able to create a new story every time. Perhaps it will be a long story; maybe small or even a single scene. But you will take the helm, in the way you want on each occasion.

The proposal of this game arose as a search. The original idea was to make a book album as open as possible: that each person, when reading it, would create their own meanings, make their own plot. This is how this book-game was born that proposes you to establish the reading rules, play with visual and written language to shape the narrative, create connections that only you will know and enjoy a different way of reading.

Name: BattleTech: Alien Worlds – Crystalline Canyon/Badlands Battlemat
Description: Each map is 34" x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

Name: Волки Одина (Wolves of Odin)
Description:
Wolves of Odin is a strategy card game with deep gameplay and great replay value.

On your turn, you take one of several available actions, for example you can play a Viking card to create or grow your own squad of warriors. Or, you can play a Viking card on an enemy squad to kill enemy warrior (to discard this card). At the end of round, players will summ the strengths of their squads of warriors and player who creates strongest squad will receive victory point(s). The game is played up to 5 victory points.

Instead of play a Viking card you can sacrifice your warriors to summon ancient gods with powerful game-changing abilities.

The game consists of series of rounds, as result of which one of the players scores 5 victory points and ends the game, so it is important to correctly calculate strength of your cards in each round.

Wolves of Odin has simple rules, but serious dilemmas arise every turn. Multiple layers of strategies create a wealth of tactical possibilities. There is also unusual passing system in the game: when a player passes, he draws new 4 cards into his hand from the deck, and every time his turn reaches him, he again draws 1 card into his hand and then discard 1 card from his hand. Thus, while other players are depleting their strength in the current round, passing player is building up power for the next round...

—description from the publisher

Name: BattleTech: Alien Worlds – Caustic Valley/Mines Battlemat
Description: Each map is 34" x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

Name: BattleTech: Alien Worlds – Fungal Crevasse/Washout Battlemat
Description: Each map is 34" x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

Name: BattleTech: Alien Worlds – Lunar Base/Sand Drifts Battlemat
Description: Each map is 34" x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

Name: Sivatagi Bújócska
Description: The meerkats are cheerfully hiding in their desert homes. Where they hide, where they emerge from their lair. If you manage to get a small animal in all the passages of a nest, you will be rewarded. Who can collect most of the butterfly disks? Try to hide the meerkats from the outpost in the nest! If they run back, find them another flight!

Name: Monopoly: Édition Côte d'Azur
Description:
Monopoly at the French Côte d'Azur - edited for the International Game Festival in Cannes 2000.

Limitied edition with number on the board
- wooden houses und hotels
- playing pieces in gold-colored metal.

Tirage original édité à l'occasion du Festival International des Jeux de Cannes. Édition numerotée à tirage limité.
Maisons et hôtels en bois. Pions de jeu en métal doré.

Name: Escape Experience Adventskalender: Die einsame Berghütte
Description:
Solve a new puzzle every day and unravel the mystery of the hidden gift factory. Find out what the lonely mountain hut and the creepy creature are all about and help your new friends...

Combine the 24 exciting puzzles with mystical objects such as a Rubik's Cube, glow-in-the-dark clues and other bizarre objects. Only the correct solution will lead you to the next door and the next puzzle. And if you get stuck, the digital extras will help you with hints and solutions to all the puzzles, as well as three hidden extra missions.

If you manage to solve every puzzle, hopefully all the presents will be ready in time for the holidays! Let the extra tricky Advent escape room experience begin!
Families: Misc: Advent / Christmas / Jule calendar game

Name: Founders of Teotihuacan: Extra Bonus Disks
Description:
4 bonus tokens you can mix with the bonus tokens of the base game. Each of them gives you more rewards (a combination of the usual rewards as a built action, an influence action, extra resources, etc) compared to the ones from the base game, but at the cost of reducing the effective power of your action.

These tokens were free if you pre-ordered Founders of Teotihuacan from the Board&Dice webshop during a certain period and they can now be bought from their webshop.
Later available as part of the Game Boy Geek Season 10 Kickstarter.

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Card Pack 2022
Description:
Some of Marvel: Crisis Protocol’s favorite fighters are back and ready to re-enter the fray with this Marvel: Crisis Protocol - Card Pack 2022! Featuring 24 updated stat cards for some of the game’s earliest heroes and villains, Marvel: Crisis Protocol - Card Pack 2022 refreshes some of the game’s most iconic characters.

In addition to the updated characters, this pack adds updated versions of 74 essential Team Tactic cards and copies of all six Infinity Gems to players’ collections, giving them everything they need to power up their teams and claim victory!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Enquêtes à Los Angeles: Nouveaux Crimes
Description:
After discovering the game and the 5 first cases as a detective or as the Chisel in "Enquêtes à Los Angeles" (the French version of Detective: City of Angels), you can know continue the experience with the 4 next cases.

WARNING: You will need the core game to play with "Nouveaux Crimes" as the box will only contain the 4 new cases and the corresponding booklets.

Even if the different cases will be slightly harder one after the other, the game stays the same: a 3 to 9 players asymmetrical investigation game.

The detectives will have to solve the case before their opponents. The Chisel will try to manage the story and how it's told, sometimes helping a detective in distress, sometimes slowing a lucky detective down, choosing the answers of the interrogated witnesses.

Every game, dive deep into the nice film noir atmosphere of Los Angeles during the 40s.

-description from publisher
Families: Game: Detective – City of Angels (Van Ryder Games)

Name: Disney Sorcerer's Arena: Epic Alliances – Turning the Tide
Description:
Take your combat skills in Disney Sorcerer’s Arena: Epic Alliances to all-new levels with the Turning the Tide expansion pack!

Davy Jones, Moana, and Stitch bring new attacks and abilities true to their characters that will change the course of the Arena’s already epic battles. Disney Sorcerer’s Arena: Epic Alliances is the ultimate PvP tabletop game for Disney and Pixar fans and gamers where players can build teams out of Disney and Pixar heroes and villains and compete in an expandable, learn-as-you-go battle arena game.

In Disney Sorcerer's Arena: Epic Alliances, you'll Recruit from a battle-ready roster of Disney and Pixar heroes and villains then combine the cards for your characters into a single deck.

You take turns playing standard actions and cards from your hand to move your characters and attack opponents. If you knock out rival characters or occupy certain spaces near the center of the arena until your next turn, you score points.

When a player reaches 20 points or runs out of cards in their deck, the game ends at the conclusion of that round, and whoever has the most points wins.

-description from publisher
Families: Game: Disney Sorcerer's Arena – Epic Alliances

Name: Sopalavras
Description:
Remember when your mother scolded you for playing with your food? Well, now she'll want to play too! Sopalavras is a game based on the famous alphabet soup: the more you move the noodles, the bigger the word you will form.

Six letter tiles are opened at the start of the round. Players try to use the revealed letters to mentally form words with at least three letters. The letters of the words already formed on the table can be used to create new words with the letter tiles of the round. When a player forms a word, he must say aloud the NUMBER of letters that word has. From there all players can keep trying to form words for as long as 1 minute. During this time, whenever a player is able to mentally form a word with an equal or greater number of letters than previously spoken, he must say that number aloud. The player who assembled the highest word wins 1 point or 2 points if he uses all 6 letter pieces in the round. The game ends when a player scores 5 points, winning the game.

Name: Joke King
Description:
Joke King is a hilarious create your own comic strip family card game for kids and adults!

In this Kingdom, laughter is the law, and the funniest player wins the Crown! Joke King was created by the team that bought you the award-winning family game, Kids Against Maturity. Here, you make funny comic strips of the KAM FAM by playing illustrated comic-book style card combinations. Joke King is simple to play and has multiple play styles and difficulties. The object is to create the funniest card combinations and show your friends that you are The Joke King!

- How To Play - 
Deal everyone 10 cards.

Choose someone to wear The Crown.

One card is flipped from the deck face up.

The Crown plays one card from their hand before or after the flipped card.

Then the other player chooses one card from their hand to finish the comic strip.

The Crown reads all cards out loud and chooses their favorite

That player wins the round, and the first player to win 5 rounds is crowned The Joke King!

Name: Bitte nicht öffnen: Bissig!
Description: In the co-operative dice game Bitte nicht öffnen – Bissig!, you need to protect Icy the yeti from Dr. Spargel and her nasty yeti catcher.

Name: Yak: Birdwatch
Description:
This mini-expansion adds an extra action card that will offer you more to think about when selecting which action to play. Plus, yaks are not the only animals in the game anymore. Their friends, the birds, have joined and will offer you a new way to score. Those birds are easily scared away, so choose well where you place them on your stone tower. And remember, an opponent can also attract these birds to his own tower! This mini-expansion adds eight colorful birds, a bag, 4 birds action cards and 16 feathers tokens. This item is a Webshop exclusive and is a must-have. These birds are simply too cute!

- description from the publisher's website

Name: Scoop
Description:
Scoop is a series of fast-paced word games where players compete to make three-letter words.

The game has 35 target cards, 2.25" x 2.25", with single letters, and 150 cards, 1.15" x 1.15", with bigrams (two letters); all cards have point values. There are rules for 4 different games. In all but one of them the bigrams are all face up on the table for all to scoop from.

1. Be Quick: Reveal a target card, and everyone has 15 seconds to gather as many bigrams as they can that make a word with that card.

2. Elimination: Reveal a target card, and each player chooses one of their 10 bigrams to make a word with it. The one with the highest-scoring word gets the points of all the cards revealed.

3. Winner Takes All: Each player chooses one of their 3 letter cards and takes a bigram to go with it. The one with the highest-scoring word gets the points of all revealed cards.

4. Scoop Five: Each player takes five bigrams, one for each of their five letter cards.  Each player scores the points for each of their words made.

Name: LockDown
Description:
LockDown is a word game where players collect letters to build successively longer words as listed in their secret, anagrammatic manifests. Players may alter others' words, and lock down their own words to prevent alteration. [adapted from the rule book.]

LockDown has 106 letter cards, 6 bonus indicators, and 20 manifest cards, each of which has four lists of four successively longer anagrams, e.g. SEA, EAST, DATES, TASTED, or RUT, ROUT, TROUT, TRYOUT. Each player is dealt 7 letter cards, one manifest, and one bonus indicator.

In a turn a player may do one of these: 
- Draw 2 cards. 
- Trade a card from the hand with another player. 
- Play one or more cards to make words on the table. 
- Add a card to another player's word to make a different word. 
- Take a card from another player's word. 
- Lock one of your words by flipping its letters face down. 
- Gather one or more letters from your words, making any words you wish, and placing unused cards back in your hand.
Then they draw or discard so their hand has 7 cards.

The round ends when someone plays an End of Round card, or plays their whole hand out and declares the round over. Then players score positive points for their words that are listed on their manifest, and negative points for their words that are not on their manifest.

Name: Option
Description:
This is an elaboration of the idea behind the traditional word game Ghost.

The deck has 61 letter cards: one is dealt to the table as the key letter, and the rest evenly divided among the 2-6 players.

On their turn, a player plays a card so that it adds to either a row or column of letters that include the key letter. The row or column played to must spell part of a valid word, whether read forwards or backwards, without actually finishing a complete word.

A player who finishes a word, or makes an invalid set of letters, or cannot make a valid play, or loses a challenge to a play, gains a point. The round ends and the deck is shuffled for another round. When a player reaches a certain number of points they are out; the last player left wins.

—user summary

Name: War of Words
Description:
This game consists of the formation and capture by reformation of words made from letters of different value, the object of the game being to use as many letters of value as possible in such formation and capture. [From the rules sheet.]

There are at least 129 letter cards, which are more like cardboard tiles, 1" x 1".  At the start, 12 are dealt to each player, and the rest are face down in the table center. In their turn, each player: 
- Draws a letter. 
- Either:
--- plays a word from the hand
--- attacks and captures another player's word by adding one or more letters to it from their hand, making a new word which has a different root meaning
--- passes
They draw 2 letters after forming or capturing a word.

The game ends when all the letters are drawn and everyone passes. Points are scored for each letter in all the words a player owns, according to the letters' ranks.  Most cards are Privates, worth 2 points, but each vowel has two cards which are officers, worth more: 
A - General (20 points)
E - Major (15 points)
I - Captain (10 points)
O - Lieutenant (5 points)
U - Sergeant (3 points)

The player with the highest score wins.

Name: Lord of the Chords: Who Let The Chords Out? – 1st Booster Pack: Advanced Chords
Description: Prepare to ask, "What chord is that?" with the Advanced Chords Pack's new game mechanic - Chord Extensions! Play crazy 9ths, 11ths and 13ths to spice up your chords and gain buffs to forte-fy your reign as the Lord of the Chords!

Name: Expedition to Skull Island
Description:
Expedition to Skull Island is a long-form solitaire print-and-play expedition, where you take the role of captain and try to bring back as much fame and treasure you can from the mystery-shrouded shores of Skull Island.

Outfit a ship, recruit a crew, and set sail!

Randomized encounters will assail you in many different environments: on the trip to the island, on the beaches, in the jungles, on the rivers, in the cliffs surrounding skull rock, in the dark, and inside skull rock itself.  With hundreds of "choose your own adventure" style paragraph encounters along with other table-based encounters, there's lots to discover and explore on the island.

Can you make it back to Tortuga alive?  Your score at the end is dependent on the goals you set at the beginning – are you looking for treasure, are you looking for adventure, or are you interested in both – and what you discover and bring back from the island.

—description from the designer

Name: Star Wars: Galactic Hide & Seek Action Board Game
Description:
"A Galactic Hide & Seek Race is underway! Obi-Won Kenobi, Anakin Skywalker, Yoda and Ahsoka Tano must find the Jedi Force tokens and be the first to race back home!

Players take the role of one of four Jedi: Obi-Won, Anakin, Yoda or Ahsoka. They take turns rolling the dice moving around the board to get to concealed Jedi tokens. When a player find all four of their character specific tokens they must race back Home before the other players to claim victory.

Name: Name The Thing: Retail Hell
Description:
Welcome to Retail Hell!  This expansion to Name The Thing introduces new 99 new cards with all new prompt and word cards from the crazy shopping frenzy that is Retail!  Add these cards to your Name The Thing collection and do your best to name even more things!

-description from publisher
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Name The Thing: After Dark
Description:
When the sun goes down this expansion comes out to play! This expansion to Name The Thing adds 99 adult only cards to your collection. Can you name all the naughty things?

-description from publisher
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Name The Thing: Sports Ball
Description:
BATTER UP! Step up to the plate with Sports Ball, the expansion to Name The Thing that introduces all sorts of Sports based words and things to name.  Can you name all the things in time for the buzzer!?

-description from publisher
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Game of Astronomy
Description:
This contains thirty-eight card, each bearing the chart of a constellation and a point value from 5 to 25, and the rule book which contains a brief story “Legends of the Zodiac”, and a set of sentences, one for each constellation card. [Adapted from the rule book.]

The cards are dealt equally to all players, except the leader who will read “Legends of the Zodiac” as rapidly as possible. When they read the name of a constellation they count to 5 rapidly. If the player holding that card calls out its name before 5 they keep it in their holdings on the table; if not, they place it in front of the player to their left. After the end of the story, players add up the points of the cards they won, and the player with the most gets a 25 point bonus. Reshuffle the deck and repeat this, rotating the leader, until someone reaches 300 points and wins, or after an agreed-on number of rounds is played, the highest score winning.

An alternate mode has the leader reading from the individual sentences of the constellations, in a randomly chosen order so players won’t know which constellation comes next.

—user summary

Name: The Melox Football Game
Description:
This is a promotional game by W.G. Clarke for their Melox Dog Foods in the 1930's. Unusually packaged in a (then) brown grocery bag.

The first player to throw a six kicks off. He then throws again and moves the counter in the direction of his opponents goal, as indicated by the dice. Should the counter fall on a line bearing one of his own players, he continues to throw except where otherwise marked, namely, if the ball lands on a line marked “Foul,” which is a blue player, the Red gets the next throw. If the ball lands on a player marked “ Hands,” then the Blue gets the next throw, and if the ball lands on either player marked “ Free Kick ” then the same side gets a further throw. If the counter finishes on a line bearing an opponent, the throw passes to the other player.

The method of scoring goals is for the counter to fall exactly on Line 12, but if it should fall on or go past Line 13, a goal kick is awarded, the counter being placed on Line 11, on the spots indicated. The centre line is a neutral line, and if the counter falls upon this line, the player continues to throw. The player whose team scores the most goals in 30 minutes (or in the period of time arranged) is the winner.

Name: Hero's Journey: Original
Description:
Hero's Journey is a fully cooperative, card-based, adventure game with rogue-like elements to be enjoyed solo or with up to 5 of your closest friends. Experience adventure with 12 unique Heroes as you navigate through dozens of guided Encounters with dangerous Monsters, intriguing Scenarios, and mesmerizing Locations; all with plenty of Loot and ever-changing Qualities to ultimately face the deadly Boss waiting at the end of the Round. No session is quite the same with dynamic, journey-altering gameplay and creative Quests. There's no time to waste, gather your party and embark on your own Hero's Journey!

The game is played with cards, dice, and tokens in a series of Rounds with a set number of Encounters in each and concluded with a Boss fight. Each player takes a turn as the Revealer, to flip an Encounter card face up to resolve combat with a Monster, make decisions in a Scenario, or feel the effects of a new Location. Play then continues with a new Revealer each Encounter until ultimately facing a Boss at the end of the Round.

Throughout the game, Qualities and Loot will play a huge part in the success or failure of the Party's journey. There are intangible Qualities that provide new active Abilities or passive Positive/Negative Traits with lingering effects. Additionally, there are physical Loot objects with powerful one-time or on-going effects. Players can never be too comfortable with their load-outs as these elements of the game are constantly changing.

This is a new take on the well-loved fantasy RPG genre allowing for solo or group play with up to six players who may all enjoy the experience simultaneously. The self-narrating story provides an opportunity for everyone to be a part without a game master or hours of preparation. The design allows for simple set-up and a low learning curve including jump-in-jump-out play without compromising on the amount of depth the experience provides. With 148 cards in the base deck and character perma-death, you'll never play the same adventure twice thanks to the well-thought out rogue-like mechanics.

—description from the publisher

Name: Word Poker
Description:
Word Poker takes the well-known framework of poker and transforms it into a compulsive family word game. Instead of normal playing cards, it uses letter cards with each letter having its own score value. The aim is to make the highest-scoring word using any combination of the five cards on the table and the five cards you are holding. There are rounds of betting where you can bet on the strength of your word to win the pot of chips. Quick start rules mean that you don't need any knowledge of poker to get playing.

—description from the back of the box (adapted)

The rules are for Texas Hold 'Em poker. All the steps are there: the flop, turn, river, etc.  Besides using letters to make words, the only rules difference is that players start with a hand of five cards rather than two.

—user summary

Name: Matricás Laci: Kapj el!
Description:
Matricás Laci quietly sneaks around. No one’s s looking. Perfect. Time to steal some sweets and cakes. Only that funny haired Sárika wouldnt have eyes everywhere. She always informs the police about Laci’s mischieves.

This is a hidden role bluffing game in which you take the role of either Laci or Sárika. The goal is to collect the most sweets for your team. You play cards secretly then resolve the actions after shuffling. A policeman takes out one Laci. One Laci can carry two sweets. The rest of the sweets go to Sárika’s team. Later you can put in special cards to make the game more exciting.

Based on the Matricás Laci stories by Adrienn Vadadi

Name: Zesty: The Slow Game
Description:
You can learn the principles of sustainability by playing with family and friends. Intelligent fun and lots of green-themed challenges.

Zesty is a game to learn how to save the environment… one challenge at a time! The funniest way to challenge yourself to change your habits step by step.

Help the Planet with small actions that can be done in an hour, a day, a weekend or even several days.

You and your team draw a Challenge card. You will have up to 1 week to complete the highest number of actions listed on the card and, thanks to ZESTY, you will be able to change your habits and those of those who will play with you.

You will read, think, play, record your team's progress on a very special log.

The Challenges are divided into five Thematic Areas: Nature, Consumption, Pollution, Society, Emotions and will allow you to reflect on many different topics related to the well-being of the Planet and its inhabitants.

Zesty is a "slow" game: your skills are not demonstrated with speed but with commitment and attention to important topics, which you can explore in a very special book.

Warning: this is a cooperative game. You win, or lose, all together!

—description from the publisher

Name: Rebellion: Britannia
Description:
Rebellion: Britannia is a game about the Roman military campaigns to suppress the Silures, Brigantes, and Boudica Rebellions (47-61 CE) and the relationships between the key British tribes.

In this game, 1-4 players take control of one of the powerful factions of the time: either Rome or one of the key British tribes—the Iceni, Silures, or Brigantes. Over the course of 12 game rounds (lasting 60-90 minutes), players attempt to gain the most victory points by controlling land, burning Roman infrastructure, and reducing enemy forces.

Rebellion: Britannia is a card-driven wargame. Each player’s available actions are largely dictated by the cards they currently have available to them, and, following a simple Sequence of Play, players use these cards to recruit and move pieces on the board, secure control of regions, engage in diplomacy, form alliances, and battle against their rivals.

Rebellion: Britannia is fast to learn—it’s a low complexity asymmetric game with few rules, a simple sequence of play, and a high quotient of strategic choices. The game depicts a dynamic military and political situation in first-century. Britain, distilled into 60-90 minutes of play time.

—description from the publisher

Name: Zheng He: Admiral of the Ming Voyages
Description:
Zheng He: Admiral of the Ming Voyages is a solitaire game that recreates the voyages of the Ming treasure fleets in the early 1400s. In the game you take the role of Zheng He, commanding the fleet as it sails the Indian Ocean, earning glory for the emperor, and keeping favor with the ministers of the court so the voyages can continue.

Your goal is to score as many Victory Points as possible before the political will to continue the voyages runs out. Victory Points are earned by visiting ports, gaining envoys, winning battles, and completing special goals. You also earn Minister Points during each voyage by trading and having good relations with ports, which determine whether the game continues with another voyage, and also allow you to upgrade and repair the fleet, and recruit and train officers.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fantasy Realms: Deluxe Edition
Description:
Bruce Glassco’s Fantasy Realms is a modern classic, and this new Deluxe Edition has updated every card with a sleek, intuitive graphic design. The base game cards have also been updated to include new art from Anthony Cournoyer to match his beloved work on The Cursed Hoard expansion, giving the entire game a fresh look!

It includes:


     The original base game with all new art and graphic design!
     The Cursed Hoard, which includes two expansion modules, also with new graphic design!
     The Jester and Phoenix cards, previously only available as promo cards!
     100+ art sleeves to protect all the included cards, plus some extras!


In Fantasy Realms, you build your Realm, one card at a time, as you collect Beasts, Armies, Wizards, and more! Each card is unique and scores points based on the other cards in your hand. You start with seven cards, and each turn you’ll draw a new card from the deck or discard, and discard one card from your hand, always trying to improve your Realm! Whoever’s realm scores the most points is the winner!

—description from the publisher

Name: Making Words Snap
Description:
Here is a fab learning device ideal for young minds to learn words and understand phonics. This unique deck of cards lets you play two family favourites, Snap and Pairs, using language concepts. For example, when playing Snap with this fantastic deck of cards, you would be trying to snap cards that create words such as 'br' and 'ain'.

To play Pairs, simply turn all the cards upside down and turn two over to see if they make a word. If they do, then the cards are kept; if not, they are turned back face down.

The aim is to collect all the cards. Two fun games in one that help children learn important language concepts.

Helping children gain a head start at school in an essential skill, Making Words Snap is the smarter way to play Snap and Pairs!

Contents: 52 playing cards [26 word beginnings of 2 letters and 26 ends of 3 letters], 3 rules cards

[The above adapted from the website, archived Sep 2015.]
Families: Series: Educational Snap and Pairs (Green Board Game Co)

Name: My First Making Words Snap
Description:
Master early years language concepts, whilst having lots of fun with this deck, through either Snap or Pairs. For example, playing Snap with this fantastic deck of cards, you are trying to snap sections of words together, such as 'c' and 'at' to form 'cat'.

To play Pairs, simply turn all the cards upside down and turn two over to see if they make a word. If they do, then you keep them; if not, you turn them back face down.

The aim is to collect all the cards. Two fun games in one that help children learn fundamental language concepts.

Helping children gain a head start at school in an essential skill, My First Making Words Snap is the smarter way to play Snap and Pairs!

Contents: 52 playing cards [26 with 1-2 letter word beginnings, 26 with 2-letter endings], 3 rules cards

[The above adapted from website, archived Sep 2015]
Families: Series: Educational Snap and Pairs (Green Board Game Co)

Name: Against the Monstrous Horde
Description:
Against the Monstrous Horde is a dice game of fantasy combat that is played using a variety of polyhedral dice.

Each player manages a set of polyhedral dice that represents a party of adventurers defending a village against an army of monstrous creatures. The players compete to see who can drive away the most enemies before the battle ends by rolling their dice and using them to attack, to heal, and/or to perform special abilities. Defeating enemies earns a player points, and gameplay ends once one player scores 100 or more points. The winner is the player who achieves the highest score.

—description from the designer

Name: Miao Bau Ciao
Description:
Three discs representing cat, dog and child are placed on the table.

Then an arrow is turned and you have to be the fastest player to put your hand on the right puck and also say the corresponding word.

So if the arrow points to the dog, you need to say BAU and put your hand on the dog's disc. If the cat comes out you have to say HELLO and put your hand on the cat. Simple isn't it?

What if we told you that there are also bonuses and penances?

—description from the designer

Name: El Alamein: Heavy Tank Battalion
Description:
This is a promotional card released for El Alamein along with the Collector's Ammo Box:
- P02 - Heavy Tank Battalion

Name: War: Game of Thrones
Description:
War: Game of Thrones is a reimplementation of War(the Brazilian version of Risk), with the theme of Game of Thrones.
The game can be played in two different ways. The first is basically the same as Risk/War, but in the map of Westeros.
The second way keep the basic mechanic of Risk/War, but in order to win, you no longer need to fulfil objective cards. What you need in to place flags of your nation on the map. In order to do so, you need to conquer a territory and spend one army.

—user summary
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire

Name: Warband: Wargaming Large Scale Dark Ages or Early Medieval Skirmish Battles
Description:
This is a set of rules for wargaming large scale Dark Ages or Early Medieval skirmish battles. It can be used with any scale figures (typically 15mm or 28mm).
Each figure on the table represents one man, and the game is designed for battles of around 50 – 100 figures per side.

Basic Concepts:
This game is played on a hex grid. Each hex must be big enough to contain at least 8 singly based foot figures, or four mounted figures.
It is designed to be played with singly based figures.
The game is card driven, so each player has a hand of cards, and cards are played to activate groups of figures and for other events.
There are no units in this game. Figures can move around freely, although they will benefit from the presence of Leaders. Figures are activated for movement, combat and shooting by hex (so some or all of the figures in a hex may move, shoot or fight when activated).
Each army has a Warlord and some Leaders. All rules applying to Leaders also apply to Warlords.

Game mechanisms:
All dice used are normal 6 sided dice. When the rules refer to a particular number that must be rolled, that number or higher must be rolled for success.

Name: Wurdz
Description:
The Wurdz deck has 31 letter cards, 21 wild cards, and 4 rules cards.

On their turn, players draw the top card, say a word, and score its points. After going through the deck the highest score wins.

There are two modes:

Alphabet Game: Say a word that has the names of one or more letters of the alphabet in its pronunciation (not its spelling).  If it's a letter card, the name of that letter must be part of it. E.g., if it's 'L', the word "elbow" has the names of the letters L and O in its pronunciation, and scores 2 points.

Word Game: Say a word that has other words as part of its pronunciation. If it's a letter card, the word must begin with that letter. E.g., if it's 'C', the word "cargo" contains the pronunciations of the words "car", "are", "go", and "oh", for 4 points.

The Wild cards specify one or more requirements:

     Single: The stated word needs only one other word or letter name as part of it. 
     Multiple: The stated word needs at least two other words or letter names. 
     Same: The stated word needs at least one other word or letter name stated at least twice. (E.g. "Ohio" says O twice.)


—user summary

Name: ヤバ百合会の妹たち (Yaba Yuri-kai no Imouto-tachi)
Description: Take the role of an incoming freshman at a traditional girls school aiming to capture the affection of your seniors by any means—using a variety of tactics from affectionate to wicked. Each player has a hand of cards matching their character, numbered 1-15. For 15 rounds, an event card with an affection point value is revealed and each player plays a number facedown. All players reveal their bids at once and the player with the highest number gains that event card. However, some events are worth negative affection and the lowest bidder must take them. If players tie for the highest (or lowest) bid, the next closest player takes the event. If players all have played the same values as another player and no player is able to obtain the event card, it remains in play and is obtained alongside the event card revealed next round, making for higher stakes. Events also have attributes which can give players bonus points at the end of the game if they collect events of the same type. After the 15th round, when players have used all the cards in their hands, the player with the most affection points wins the game.

Name: F-Life: Dildos & Dolls
Description: This expansion adds 50 cards including a bunch of relationship cards, Backstories, and more!

Name: Okanagan Shuffle
Description:
Okanagan Shuffle is a word card game apparently produced for and sold in the Okanagan Valley of British Columbia. The picture on the back of the cards is of a wind surfer on Lake Okanagan, and the box features a cartoon of Ogopogo, the legendary creature inhabiting that lake.

The game comes with two decks, each with 51 letter cards and 2 wild cards named for Ogopogo. There are rules for five games:

1. A rummy-like game. 
Players are dealt 7 cards, and on your turn you may:
- Play a word of 3+ letters from the hand, 4+ if you haven't played a word yet. 
- Take a letter out of any played word of 4+ letters, rearranging the remaining letters to make a word, and using the taken letter with letters in your hand to make a new word.
- Replace Ogopogo with the letter it currently stands for and use it to make a new word from your hand.
- Draw a card. You may use it to do any of the plays above. 
When one player uses up all cards in hand, the hand ends and each player gets one point per card in hand. After a certain number of hands, the lowest total wins.

2. A children's game reminiscent of Rack-o.
Each player has 5 cards in hand, and on their turn draws from the draw or discard pile, and discards. The first player to have 5 consecutive letters in hand wins.

3. A Gin Rummy-like game with growing hand size.
Deal N cards to each player, who in their turn draws and discards, and lays down their entire hand to spell a word if they can, after which everyone else gets one more turn to try to do the same. Each player who lays down a word gets one point for the hand.  The number N of cards dealt (and hence the length of the target word) starts at 2, and increases one per hand until N=8.  The highest point total wins.

4. Themed words.
The dealer declares a theme -- e.g. animals, colors, girls' names, etc. -- and deals each player 7 cards. Players draw and discard as in game 3. The game ends when a player can lay down a word of any length that fits the theme declared by the dealer.

5. Solitaire.
Draw 5 cards, and try to make and lay down a word of 3 or more letters. Draw cards as needed. You win if you can use the entire deck making legal words.

Name: Takumi Zoo
Description:
Takumi Zoo is a zoo management themed game, created during the designer's summer break of the first grade, and published while they were in the 4th grade. The game won the kid creator award for the STEAM Toy Contest 2021.

In the game, players will be adding terrain tiles to support different animals.  Animals added to a zoo increase the zoo's revenues, allowing them to buy other animals.  The zoos have a limited number of space, and players will also remove animals from their zoo to make room for new ones.

The game includes some tiles that have special effects, and bonuses that can be earned for certain groupings of animals.

The player with the most points after 12 rounds wins.

Name: Kabuto Sumo: Andre the Goliath Promo
Description: Released as part of the 2022 Kickstarter bundle for Kabuto Sumo, this promo adds a new wrestler Andre, and his signature move piece (a peanut).

Name: Roll or Die
Description:
You are a band of mighty heroes delving deep into a dungeon rife with treasure and troubles. The skills of the Wizard and the Rogue allow you to navigate the mazes, puzzles and traps with ease. The mighty Fighter decimates the weak goblins and orcs in your path, and the Cleric eliminates the undead with blasts of holy light. But every now and then a more troublesome foe presents itself, and you must work together to defeat the most
dangerous creatures in the dungeon. It is time to Roll... or Die!
In Roll or Die players take turns rolling 5 polyhedral dice (d6,d8,10,d12, and d20)and taking actions to adjust or reroll. After 3 actions the dice are considered "locked" and a result must be filled in on the player sheet, in a series of specific requirements.
After 33 turns all boxes are either filled in or crossed out, and each player will have a final score. The highest scoring player is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: BIGFOOT: Roll & Smash – MODS Expansion
Description:
The action gets bigger and louder with two new trucks and a crew of experts.

MORE MONSTER MAYHEM!
More players at the table = more fun. Expand the player count of BIGFOOT: Roll & Smash to 6 Players AND get two more trucks from TEAM BIGFOOT's history: BIGFOOT #5 and Ms Bigfoot.

GET A CREW 
Every driver needs a great crew. With this expansion, you'll get a chance to draft Monster Truck experts to help you plan and execute your run.

MODS Expansion Includes:

     5 - 6 Player Rules
     CREW expansion - Draft Monster Truck Experts to your team!
     *BONUS* - 8 new Obstacle Tiles


Featuring two fan-favorite playable BIGFOOT trucks:

     World Record Breaker -  BIGFOOT #5
     Queen of Crush - Ms. Bigfoot
     Player boards and Style decks for each truck


—description from the publisher

Name: Rugpull
Description:
A rug pull is a degenerate act in the world of cryptocurrency trading where developers scam investors and traders alike by pumping up the price of a coin and later dumping as much as they can for profit before abandoning their project.

Rugpull is a cryptocurrency trading board game that simulates what it feels like to facilitate or be the a victim of a rug pull. Players will compete to out trade and out mine other players to end up with the highest profit. By managing your risk properly or by being risky biscuit, you must take the necessary actions to come out as the most profitable degenerate.

The main object of the game is to attain as much victory points by collecting money tiles and money cards throughout the game.

Each player will start with a secret coin as well as 30 money tiles that corresponds to the colour of their wallet(player mat)and take turns in a clockwise direction. There are 6 different actions but players may only perform up to 5 different actions during their turn (some actions can be performed more than once per turn). These actions can be performed in any order:

Buy a coin (Players who choose to buy cannot sell a coin on the same turn)
Sell a coin (Players who choose to sell cannot buy a coin on the same turn)
Mine money cards
Draw support cards
Activate support cards (You can do this action more than once per turn)
Rug pull (You can do this action more than once per turn)

Money tiles that are collected and taken away are placed on the area of the player mat(wallet) where it says "Total Balance". For the end game scoring money tiles are worth different amount of VP depending on their colour. Money tiles that are the same colour as the wallet is worth 1VP and money tiles that are not white and are not the same colour as the wallet are worth 3VP.Money cards collected are worth 2 points each. The Player with the highest VP wins!

When there is a tie, the player to memorize Proverbs 13:11 ~ "Wealth gained hastily will dwindle,
but whoever gathers little by little will increase it." first will win the game.

Name: Skytear: Embassy Ruins
Description:
The battle for Ahasa has reached its apex: as armies breach its sanctums, banners are once more crossed, awakening old rivalries. Where once the glorious Nuptian Embassy ruled, now only a crater dwells, made of crumbled walls and smashed doors. Through its halls covered by debris, Heroes still fight to claim dominion of the Ashen Fortress.

Embassy Ruins is a new and quick-to-play 3-lane battlefield supporting 4 heroes per side. The box contains a neoprene playmat with stitched edges measuring 35x53cm (14x21in).

—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeon Hero: Volume One – Starter Set
Description:
Dungeon Hero is a simple, fast, solitaire RPG game in a print-and-play "zine" format.

Create a hero using eight defining characteristics, like Archer of the Realm or Chainmail or Stealthy.  Assign them dice ranging from d12 to d6. Note your Health and Stamina levels, and then select an adventure 'zine.

Each adventure 'zine packs a lot of adventure for such a little size! Using a clever new exploration mechanic, each foray into the dungeon will offer different challenges using a simple combination of two dungeon elements.  Select two of your own traits and roll off against the two dungeon elements, and see if you can beat the dangerous situation.  If you roll well, you survive to continue deeper.  If you fail, you will take damage. But don't despair – you can spend Stamina to re-roll dice before you apply their effects!

If you can make it through the dungeon, you win! Your score is how many treasures you manage to bring out of the dungeon – see if you can beat your high score by playing again!

Volume One of Dungeon Hero contains three eight-page 'zines that you print out, cut, and fold yourself:


     Dungeon Hero Core Rules – The core rulebook for playing Dungeon Hero. Explains the rules for character creation and gameplay, and provides an example of play.



     Castle Charon – Robed cultists have been seen filing into the ruins of King Charon's castle. Chanting has been heard, and demons have been sighted. Can you set things right?



     Fortress of the Frost Giant Jarl – Freezing and starving, you find a Viking outpost, but to stay with them for the winter, you must help them put down the Frost Giant jarl.

Name: Dungeon Hero: Volume Two – Giant Beasts
Description:
Already played all the adventures from Dungeon Hero: Volume One â€“ Starter Set?  Went straight to Volume Three: Bump in the Night and skipped Volume Two?  Well, more adventures await! Print these out, fold 'em up, and get questing!

Dungeon Hero: Volume Two features three new adventures centered around a theme of Giant Beasts:


     Web of the Spider Queen – The Queen of Spiders seeks to conquer the sunlit world above. Can you stop her before she rises?



     Tower of the Terrapin – The Terrapin Cult hoards the only cure a beloved mentor needs. But can friends made in the City of Scoundrels be trusted to help infiltrate the tower?



     The Lost Island – Shipwrecked on an island that was nowhere to be found on the maps, you struggle to survive on an island stuck in time.


Bonus Adventure! Also gain access to the bonus adventure:


     The New Hill – A massive mound of dirt and sand appears in a farmer's field. What terrors does it herald?


Note: You will need the core rulebook from the Starter Set (Volume One) of Dungeon Hero to play these adventures.

Name: Dungeon Hero: Volume Three – Bump in the Night
Description:
Already played all the adventures from Dungeon Hero: Volume One â€“ Starter Set and tore through all the challenges in Volume Two: Giant Beasts?  Well, maybe it's time you face off against the terrors that dwell in dark places! Print these out, fold 'em up, and get questing!

Dungeon Hero: Volume Three features three new adventures centered around a theme of paying homage to silver screen horror movies:


     Full Moon Frenzy – Something is stalking the night under the light of the full moon. Can you stop its rampage?



     The Terror of Talonberg – A fortune-teller has read to you her cards, but can her prophecies really help you destroy the evil terrorizing the town?



     The Pyramid of Semerkhet – Dehydrated and exhausted, you see the pyramid on the horizon. If not water, at least shade may be found – but what other horrors await you in that awful tomb?


Bonus Adventure! Also gain access to the bonus adventure:


     Creature of the Ebon Fen – A group of scholars have hired you to escort them to a lagoon of biological interest, but are the rare fish there worth the risk of entering the unknown jungle?

Name: Fable on Your Table: Realm of Goblyns
Description:
Realm of Goblyns is a new realm for the Fable on Your Table print-and-play miniatures game which adds new enemies and challenges to the base game.

The threat of the goblyns has always been near; the creatures live in the nearby wilderness, but they typically kept to themselves. But something sinister is driving them into the civilized lands, arming them, training them, coordinating their attacks, and stoking hatred. What was once an uneasy truce has devolved into bloodshed. The mothers of Bandi look to you, hero, to do what is necessary to avert this imminent threat.

Realm of Goblyns includes:

Several new base enemy types: Goblyn warriors, Goblyn archers, Goblyn shamans, Hobgoblyns, evil presences, and assassins.

New large enemies: Goblyn archer towers and the terrifying Apex Goblyn.
Some new scenery to spice up your table play.

The companion web app has been updated to generate dungeons and quests with these creatures.

Download the PDF, print it (we recommend on card stock), assemble the miniatures, and get ready to delve into the dungeon!

—description from the designer

Name: La Cigale et la Fourmi
Description:
The game theme refers to a tale by La Fontaine: The grasshopper and the ant.
Each player starts with his ant tile in one corner of the board designed as a 9 by 9 grid. On your turn, place one tile of your hand on the board to extend your route and advance your ant on it. Alternatively, with a grasshopper tile, you can block the route of an opponent. By paying a grain of wheat, you can deblock your route. By landing on a space with a grain of wheat, you collect it. The player with the most grains wins.

—user summary

Name: Outbreak on Hypatia
Description:
Science officers brought back a strange alien fungus from a survey mission to an asteroid. Following the usual protocols, the fungus was placed in quarantine, but its explosive growth when exposed to the warmth of the ship caused it to break out of its containment area, shattering the glass and releasing spores into the ventilation shafts.

Now, the alien fungus, dubbed the "Phage" by the ship's scientists, is infecting the crew, turning them into lurching, zombie-like horrors that are taking over the ship! The central power grid has failed, and half the crew are either infected or still in cryosleep.

As captain, it's your job to make the life-and-death decisions. You need to get as many crew members off the ship as possible, but you cannot allow the Phage to escape. You'll have to wake the remaining crew members from cryosleep, power up the lifeboat hangar, keep the oxygen flowing, and initiate the self-destruct sequence. Consult your science officers to gain insights into how the Phage works. Send your engineers to jury-rig mechanisms to keep the Phage at bay. Task your operations personnel with keeping the oxygen flowing and the power online. Order your security officers to cover the retreat of your crew. How many can you save from humanity's first encounter with the Phage?

In this strategic solitaire game, you play cards that represent your crew members to different areas of the ship. The game also plays "Phage" cards representing the ever-advancing influence of the alien fungus to the same areas. Using a simple trick-taking mechanic, you quickly determine whether the humans successfully achieve their goals (such as powering up the Bio Lab or restoring the oxygen supply by repairing the oxygen scrubbers), or whether the Phage have killed off the humans attempting to do so.

Each "station" on the ship provides different winning and losing effects, and managing these effects in the face of the onslaught of the Phage is the key to rescuing crew members from the ship. You win by activating the self-destruct sequence and destroying all of the Phage. You lose if the Phage escapes the ship. Your score at the end of the game is how many of your crew members escape.

Name: Tiny Epic Vikings: Ragnarok
Description:
In Tiny Epic Vikings: Ragnarok, you will have to sharpen your axes and your skill as you explore new islands and experience firsthand the battle of the Giants (Jötunn) vs. the Gods and the cunning of the Valkyries. The Ragnarok expansion introduces Giants that will control the islands and weaken the god's fury. It also introduces Valkyries and Giant Slayers that will join forces with your Vikings to combat the Giants! Also included are 6 new gods to further expand the strategies and variability of Tiny Epic Vikings!

-description from Kickstarter campaign

Name: No Soldier Left Behind: Battle of the Bulge
Description: No Soldier Left Behind is a cooperative wargame which puts each player into the shoes of a single American soldier. By choosing what to focus on – firing on the enemy, being stealthy, or even summoning your courage by looking at a photo of the girl back home - you test your mettle against the forces of the German army. Can you complete your mission, and bring back all your buddies in the process?
Families: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

Name: Welcome Aboard, Captain: Charon Wormhole
Description:
Learn to play Welcome Aboard, Captain with this exciting adventure that leads you through all the core mechanics of the game.

Welcome Aboard Captain is a solitaire print-and-play tabletop roleplaying game where you play a starship captain, gather a crew, outfit a ship, and head into the galaxy to complete missions.

Charon Wormhole is a special document designed to teach you how to play by introducing the rules step by step as you go through an adventure.

To play, you will need:


     This document, accessible in a reader. Do not print it – it's a hyperlinked "choose your own adventure" style document intended to be played on your device.



     Paper and pencil. (Index cards recommended.)



     At least one set of polyhedral dice: d4, d6, d8, d10, d12.  Four sets recommended, but not necessary.

Name: Welcome Aboard, Captain
Description:
"Welcome Aboard, Captain" is a solitaire science-fiction tabletop roleplaying game.

In this game, you take the role of a starship captain, recruit a crew of bridge officers (science, engineering, etc.), outfit your ship, and head out into the galaxy to go on missions.

The game is a print-and-play game; you only need to print the starship sheet and the bridge officer roster to play, although there are some handy reference sheets to print as well.  The game comes with a pre-made ship and crew if you don't want to create your own.

The game features a procedural mission generator, where you roll dice to define a mission for your starship captain, and then you perform a series of "command decisions" that the generator reacts to, allowing a dynamic adventure to unfold based on tables you roll on in the book.

Challenges are met by rolling dice from the ship and crew against threats that the procedural generator creates; whichever die is highest is the one that determines what happens.  As you work your way through the mission, you'll be rolling to advance your mission until it is completed, but surprise revelations and other unexpected challenges can throw plot twists into the narrative.

In addition to the core gameplay, there are three "gamebooks" with the game that let you play the game with the same mechanics but through pre-written adventures. One of them, "Charon Wormhole", is a learn-to-play adventure where you are introduced to the mechanics of the game while playing through a tense adventure about taking your first command.

The core game also includes optional extension materials for advanced play, adding excursion vehicles, companions, vignette missions, and nemesis enemies.

Name: Tablero di Berona
Description:
Tablero di Berona is a quick-playing dice game for two players, with all the look and feel of a classic pub game. The game uses a simple 3x6 board, two dice, and twelve stacking pieces per player.

Players take turns rolling two dice. With each die, they may either place a new chip on that location in their home row, or move a stack from their home row if they already have a stack in that space. Movement is similar to games like Backgammon, Kalah (Mancala), Veritas, or Tak: a stack of chips is dropped one piece at a time, covering other stacks as it goes.

When either player runs out of options, the other player gets just one more turn, and then the winner is the player who captures the most points in the center.

-description from publisher's website

Name: PowerCore: Call of Cthulhu
Description:
Lurking behind the thin vale of sanity, ancient beings of imaginable power lurk, forever ready to bring the world to its knees. These godlike beings from beyond time and space can warp the mind, break the will, and obliterate the body. Now, as they stand against each other, the world will be plunged into a maelstrom of horror and madness. Will your hand guide the victors - or will your eternal legacy be wiped out by a being more cunning, more ruthless, and more malevolent than you?

Welcome to a world of unspeakable horror inspired by the works of Howard Phillips Lovecraft, and the Call of Cthulhu roleplaying game, where beings older than time itself manifest on Earth and fight each other, as they prepare to dominate our world.

During the game, you will take on the role of an alliance of two nightmarish creatures from the Cthulhu mythos. Your cards will generate Horror that will allow you to power especially formidable abilities and effects, including summoning your Avatars to the field of battle.

At the beginning of your turn you rotate the Power Cores on the Character cards and other cards in play area, dealing damage to the opponent, gaining defense and raising horror - a special resource used for powerful actions. Then you can play up to two actions, chosen from: rotating a chosen Power Core again, playing a card (ally, ability, item or maneuver), drawing a card or sometimes summoning an Avatar. At the end there is an obligatory card draw. You win if you deal enough damage to the opponent's Characters or if your opponent has to draw a card from an empty deck.

-description from publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Creatures and Caverns
Description:
On the outskirts of the village of Handerley there lies the entrance to a large network of caverns running deep below the ground. And within these caverns can be found untold treasure - riches jealously guarded by all manner of fearsome creatures. Many a brave, or foolish, soul has ventured into the darkness to seek their fortune. But very few have returned to tell their tale.

Creatures and Caverns is a solo game consisting of just 18 cards and is played completely in-hand.

The aim of the game is to journey through 3 levels of pathways and caverns, overcoming creatures and other obstacles to gain treasure and useful items... and to make it out alive!

The game was developed as an entry in the 2022 In-Hand Game Design Contest.

-description from designer

Name: Das Beste würfeln
Description:
An educational game for coffee-traders produced for the biggest coffee trader in Germany "Tchibo".
Try to get the biggest income -
answer questions -
includes 6 beautiful designed car-minis.

Name: Golden Annual Number 3: Great War at Sea – South Seas Mandate
Description:
Great War at Sea: South Seas Mandate is based on what US Navy planners foresaw as the opening stages of War Plan Orange, the plan for a Pacific naval war against Japan. It is set in the years just after the First World War and features ships planned but never built: the American Design 150 battle cruiser, the Japanese Type X light battlecruiser, the original design for Japan’s Furutaka-class light cruiser and more.

Great War at Sea: South Seas Mandate includes 50 die-cut and silky-smooth playing pieces, thirty double-sized “long” ship pieces and 20 standard-sized square ones. There’s a 22x17-inch map (on heavy rigid stock), and a booklet with ten scenarios and the background story of the campaign.

-description from publisher's website
Families: Series: Great War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Tinderblox Sunset
Description:
Tinderblox Sunset puts players in a campfire setting in which each player attempts to keep the fire burning, but if you place the blocks badly, you risk burning down the camp!

Each turn, players draw a card from the campfire deck which instructs them to place a log, an ember, or any combination of them in various orientations on top of the campfire. Players use tweezers to "play with fire" and if you drop anything, you're considered a fire hazard and you're removed from the game. The player who is the most careful with fire wins!

Differences between Tinderblox Day, Night and Sunset:
Tinderblox Day is the original game.
Tinderblox Night is a limited edition version which includes more challenging cards.
Tinderblox Sunset includes the Marshmallow mini-expansion (otherwise sold separately) and is made from FSC-compliant materials.

Name: Alphabet Mix
Description:
Alphabet Mix is a word game for English- or French-speaking children. It has 78 letter cards and 2 wild cards, the cards being more like cardboard tiles, 2" x 2". It is a variant of the traditional game Memory.

The 80 cards are laid out in a 8x10 grid face down. The first player states a word of 3+ letters. Then each player in turn reveals two cards, and if either of both of them spell the next letters of the stated word, they add them to the word and score their point values; otherwise they replace unused tiles face down. The word must be spelled in order. The player who finishes the current word states another word, and play continues spelling the new word. Once 5 words have been spelled, all the cards are reshuffled and re-dealt.

The player who achieves an agreed-on total -- 50 is recommended for beginners -- wins the game.

Name: Wordy Birdy
Description:
Wordy Birdy is a turn-based card game version of "word find" puzzles. Its deck has 66 letter cards and 3 "Wordy Birdy" wild cards that stand for any letter. Letters have a point value; wild cards have 0 points. One copy of each vowel is a "Double word score" card.

Each player is dealt 5 cards, then 40 more cards are dealt into an 8x5 array, face up.  Each player in their turn makes a word out of letters in the grid with one card from the hand. The letters in the grid must make a chain of adjacent cards that doesn't overlap itself; the card from the hand can be inserted anywhere in the word, including the first letter.  The player keeps those letters and their score, and the dealer fills the holes in the array from the deck, until it is used up. A player may pass if they can see no play.

The games ends after each player has made 5 words, or each player passes in turn. The highest total score wins.

Name: Touched On: Hurstbridge Booster
Description:
A booster train line for Touched On, allowing 1 extra player to join for a fashionable festive season…

-description from the publisher's website

Name: Jewels of Puerto Primo
Description: A set collection game for 2-4 players. Players are pirates out to sell the most valuable jewelry to the self-crowned king of the Caribbean over the course of one year. Players assemble cards representing jewelry of seven different types with seven different gems. There are an assortment of bonuses to be earned when the jewelry is sold. The princess will pay for the number of pieces in the set (1 Real for 1 piece up to 21 Reals for 6 pieces). The queen will pay a bonus for three different types of either setting and/or gem that change each month. And the king pays for sets at the end of the year; his demands are revealed one-at-a-time at the beginning of each month. After a year of selling jewels to the family, if you can sail away with the most doubloons you win.

Name: Exploding Words
Description:
The Exploding Words deck has 69 letter cards and 1 rules card. Each vowel has 3 normal cards, 1 double word score card, and 1 Kaboom card.

Each player is dealt a 7-card hand, and then over 5 rounds, players draw a card then discard a card, trying to have the best words to play.  After 5 rounds players in turn lay down the word(s) from their hand.

Kaboom cards cannot be discarded, and they blow up any word they are in, giving it no score. A Kaboom card can be played in one of your words, blowing it up but leaving the other words okay, or you can keep it in hand and play it on top of an identical letter in a word someone else plays after you. If you don't play a Kaboom in any word, yours or someone else's, your whole hand explodes and you get 0 points that hand. 7-letter words are immune to explosion.

After all words are revealed and exploded, players score for their remaining words and another hand is played. The first player who gets a total score of 100 or more wins the game.

Name: Crokinole Imperium
Description:
Crokinole Imperium brings three brand new experiences to the classic game of crokinole, by introducing new cards and rules that are combined with rich Medieval-Latin lore.

SUB ROSA meaning, “Under the Rose” is a Latin phrase that has been used in the middle ages to denote secrecy or confidentiality. In this game each player will earn points by completing their unique objective card and by outscoring their opponents.

FREE LANCES refers to mercenaries whose lance was free of any lord’s service. Each mercenary will offer you a single use ability that could tip the round in your favor, but be careful not to let their valuable skills go to waste.

TERRA NOVA meaning, "New Land" brings about a new land card each round that applies to all players requiring you to significantly alter your strategy. Learn the terrain and use it to your advantage or fail to adapt and see an abrupt end to your thoughts of victory.

—description from the designer

Name: The Secret of John Nebthos
Description:
Secret of John Nebthos A Card Game of Adventure and Fame!

John Nebthos, the world's most eclectic explorer, has mysteriously sent a letter to exploring guilds around the world; an invitation to McGuffin Mountain to rediscover the lost treasures of history locked away in Nebthos' hidden mountain vault. Race against other guild members in the pursuit of fame and treasure as you travel from the four corners of the earth to McGuffin Mountain. Make new discoveries, thwart your opponents, and enjoy some good espresso along your journey, until you breach the mountain to uncover the treasures within...and of course before the mountain inevitably explodes.

A fun ice breaker card game for 2-4 players Ages 12+ 30 Minutes Playtime

—description from the publisher

Name: Conspiracy
Description:
Conspiracy is a card game released in spring 2023, on Kickstarter and was chosen Project We Love by KS. It is a fun, fast-paced tableau-builder for those who wanna try what it's like to be a conspiracy theory believer.

Chose your core conspiracy (card) and build your unique theory around it by winning news (cards) and explaining how those fit your theory.
